title: Long-Running Series
text: Supernatural is one of the longest-running fantasy TV series in the U.S., spanning 15 seasons from 2005 to 2020.

title: Original Concept
text: The show was originally planned to be a three-season series, but its popularity led to an extended run.

title: Brotherly Love
text: The central theme revolves around the Winchester brothers, Sam and Dean, played by Jared Padalecki and Jensen Ackles, respectively.

title: Meta Episodes
text: Supernatural is known for its meta episodes, where the characters acknowledge their existence as TV show characters. Notable examples include "The French Mistake" and "Changing Channels."

title: Kripke's Baby
text: The phrase "Kripke's baby" refers to the '67 Impala, named after the show's creator, Eric Kripke.

title: Tribute to Classic Rock
text: The show heavily features classic rock music, especially Kansas' "Carry On Wayward Son," used in the "The Road So Far" recaps for season finales.

title: Multiple Roles
text: Several actors played multiple roles throughout the series. For instance, Jeffrey Dean Morgan played both John Winchester (father) and the Winchester family's arch-enemy, Azazel.

title: Castiel's Origins
text: The character Castiel, played by Misha Collins, was initially introduced as a guest star for a few episodes but became a series regular due to fan popularity.

title: Jared Padalecki's Injury
text: During the filming of Season 2, Jared Padalecki injured his wrist. The injury was incorporated into the show, and Sam's hand injury in that season mirrored Padalecki's real-life situation.

title: On-Screen Chemistry
text: The chemistry between the two lead actors was so strong that they often ad-libbed lines, contributing to the authentic feel of their brotherly relationship.

title: Dean's Fear
text: Jensen Ackles, who plays Dean, has a fear of real-life morgues, making the scenes shot in morgues challenging for him.

title: Bloody Mary
text: The first season's "Bloody Mary" episode was inspired by the urban legend of the ghostly figure who appears in mirrors.

title: Mark Sheppard's Cameo
text: Mark Sheppard, who played Crowley, was initially supposed to appear in only one episode. However, his character became a fan favorite and a recurring antagonist.

title: Creator's Cameo
text: Eric Kripke, the show's creator, made a cameo appearance in the "Swan Song" episode as a janitor.

title: Baby in Every Episode
text: The '67 Impala appears in every single episode, becoming a beloved symbol of the series.

title: Gag Reels
text: Supernatural's gag reels are famous for showcasing the cast's fun and camaraderie on set, often filled with laughter and bloopers.

title: Kansas Concert
text: To celebrate the 200th episode, the band Kansas, whose song "Carry On Wayward Son" is associated with the show, performed on set.

title: Crossroads Demon Deals
text: The crossroads demon deals, where characters sell their souls, are inspired by the legend of Robert Johnson, a blues musician who allegedly sold his soul to the devil.

title: Deeper Meaning of Numbers
text: The show often uses the number 7 as a significant motif, reflecting the seven deadly sins and the seven virtues.

title: Scary Beginnings
text: The pilot episode, titled "Pilot," was filmed in one of the most haunted places in Vancouver, where the series was primarily shot.

title: Monster Encyclopedia
text: The show draws inspiration from various mythologies and folklore, creating an extensive "monster encyclopedia" for the Supernatural universe.

title: The Real Ghostbusters
text: In the episode titled "The Real Ghostbusters," fans attend a Supernatural convention, and the cast plays exaggerated versions of themselves.

title: Destiel Fan Controversy
text: The fan-created term "Destiel" refers to the perceived romantic relationship between Dean and Castiel. This ship became a topic of much discussion and controversy within the fanbase.

title: Time Travel Shenanigans
text: The show explores time travel on several occasions, including the use of angelic time travel and encounters with historical figures.

title: Behind-the-Scenes Directors
text: Several cast members directed episodes. Jensen Ackles directed multiple episodes, including the series finale.

title: Dean's Food Preferences
text: Dean Winchester's love for food, particularly burgers, pie, and classic rock references, became a trademark of the character.

title: Bobby Singer's Name Origin
text: The character Bobby Singer, played by Jim Beaver, was named after a friend of Eric Kripke's father.

title: Ending on Their Terms
text: The decision to end the series with Season 15 was a mutual one between the actors and the network, allowing the show to conclude on its own terms.

title: Legacy and Impact
text: Supernatural's legacy extends beyond its TV run, with a dedicated fanbase, conventions, and spin-offs like "The Winchesters," exploring the Winchester family's backstory.

title: Dean’s Iconic Leather Jacket Was Stolen
text: Dean Winchester's iconic leather jacket disappeared in season 6 due to a real-life theft during a photoshoot in Los Angeles, leading to a wardrobe change for the character.

title: Castiel Is The Angel Of Thursday
text: Castiel, the angel in Supernatural, is known as the 'Angel of Thursday,' aligning with the show's original air day. The character draws inspiration from real-world angels like Cassiel, the Angel of Temperance.

title: Castiel Has Gone Through Three Versions Of His Trench Coat
text: Castiel's trench coat, a significant part of Supernatural, went through three versions over the years, each enduring various challenges alongside the character.

title: Shared Filming Locations With Smallville, The X-Files, Arrowverse, And More
text: Supernatural shares filming locations in Vancouver with popular shows like Smallville, The X-Files, and the Arrowverse, creating a common backdrop for various TV series.

title: The Meaning Of Carver Edlund (Chuck’s Pen Name)
text: Chuck Shurley's pen name 'Carver Edlund' in Supernatural is an inside joke, combining the names of the show's writers Jeremy Carver and Ben Edlund, adding a humorous touch to the character's identity.

title: Jared And Jensen Were Groomsmen At Each Other’s Weddings
text: Jared Padalecki and Jensen Ackles, not just co-stars but close friends, served as groomsmen at each other's weddings, emphasizing their enduring bond both on and off-screen.

title: The Ackles Family Affair
text: Jensen Ackles' family members, including his wife Danneel, father Alan, mother Donna, sister Mackenzie, and brother-in-law Gino Graul, made appearances in various episodes of Supernatural.

title: Misha Collins Regrets Castiel's Deep Voice
text: Misha Collins, who portrayed Castiel in Supernatural, expressed regret over choosing a deep voice for the character, citing its toll on his throat during the show's run.

title: Padaleki Family
text: Jared Padaleki met his wife in season 4, his co-star who played Ruby. They had chemistry both on on screen and in real life.
